title: What is the order of priority in a bankruptcy?
question: I am a business owner and am considering declaring bankruptcy. What is the order that payments are made to those that I owe (i.e. employees, vendors, bank...)?
question_tags: Child support,Sole proprietorship,LLC (limited liability company),Small business taxes,Bankruptcy,Debt,Priority debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Business,Tax law
answers: Secured creditors generally get paid before unsecured creditors. Talk to a bankruptcy lawyer for advice.

You've gotten some pretty solid advice here: Administrative fees are first (payment to professionals who work on your case), then secured creditors, then unsecured creditors with "priority" (such as debt to employees, IRS, alimony, child support), and then unsecured creditors. This is a very, very simplified summary and a bankruptcy lawyer, or perhaps a more specific question listing the debts you are concerned about, may help answer your inquiry better. Also, please note that a chapter 13 case is for individuals only, so if you're looking to reorganize your business you would need to consider filing a chapter 11 case which is more complex and costly. Good luck!!

If you are contemplating filing a chapter 7, secured creditors either get paid by you or they can repossess their secured property. Unsecured creditors are paid in the order defined in 11 USC 507(a). You should take specific questions to an experienced bankruptcy attorney that can describe how your various priority claims fit in the proper category to help answer this question.

If you are contemplating chapter 13, basically the same thing happens. In your arear, the Chapter 13 Plan is pre-determined in the manner it pays creditors, but you may have the choice of paying some secured creditors either directly or through the chapter 13 trustee. Priority debts are still defined under the stame statute as chapter 7 with general unsecured creditors paid last.

Bankruptcy priorities are dealt with under Title 11 of the US Code. Typically, administrative expenses get paid first, then priority claims such as wages and taxes. Sure would have helped to know if your business organized as a corp or LLC or is a sole proprietorship, because a formal structure will result in no discharge of the debts. Hope this perspective helps!
Employees also have priority. I'm changing the category.
